Key Arguments: The legislation will harm Australians by silencing them and suppressing individual rights.
Freedom of speech, thought, and expression are fundamental democratic rights that should not be suppressed.
The solution to misinformation is more open discussion and collaboration, not suppression.
The proposed binding code for digital platforms is seen as a dangerous extension of totalitarianism.
There is a lack of transparency and appeals process in the legislation for content removal.
Past government attempts to define misinformation, such as during the Covid-19 pandemic, have proven to be flawed.
Notable Quotes: The answer to wrong speech, bad speech - is more speech!
A binding code which you propose... is a dangerous extension of a totalitarianism of agenda.
This one example shows why giving the government even more power is a recipe for disaster.
